name: ResistorColorCode
tagline: This little OS X utility returns a resistor value from its color code.
body:
# ResistorColorCode
=================
This little OS X utility returns a resistor value from its color code. It is a very simple way to control a resistor when your working on electronic projects.

## Current Features
=================
Simply click on colors buttons to get a resistor value from its three first bands.

![Screen Shot at startup](https://github.com/NSenaud/ResistorColorCode/blob/master/Screen%20Shots/Screen%20Shot%201.png?raw=true)
![Typing the resistor's bands value](https://github.com/NSenaud/ResistorColorCode/blob/master/Screen%20Shots/Screen%20Shot%202.png?raw=true)
![Result!](https://github.com/NSenaud/ResistorColorCode/blob/master/Screen%20Shots/Screen%20Shot%203.png?raw=true)

## What's next?
=================
I hope to be able to improve design, to get color on buttons unless the color name, and why not to add Dictation support. If you have any idea, send to nicolas at senaud dot fr.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
